title: Identify Forbidden Values
text: To find the domain of the function $$f(x)=\frac{9}{x-6}$$, we need to identify any values of $$x$$ that make the denominator zero, as division by zero is undefined.

title: Check if $$x=6$$ is Allowed
text: Substitute $$x=6$$ into the denominator to check if it makes the denominator zero: $$(6-6)=0$$.

title: Exclude $$x=6$$ from the Domain
text: Since the denominator becomes zero when $$x=6$$, $$x=6$$ is not part of the domain. We need to exclude this value in our domain interval.

title: Express Domain Using Interval Notation
text: The domain consists of all other real numbers except $$x=6$$. In interval notation, this is represented as $$(-\infty,6) \cup (6,\infty)$$.

title: Select the Correct Interval Notation
text: Select the answer that correctly represents the domain of f(x):
